definition[0]: to feel that you ought to do something, because it is morally right or your duty to do it
example[0]: Ian felt bound to tell Joanna the truth.
example[1]: Well, I’m bound to say  (=I feel I ought to say), I think you’re taking a huge risk.
example[2]: A son is duty bound to look after his mother.
note[0]: be duty bound/honour bound to do something
